detaileddescription.para: The main efficiency storage location
The replica efficiency storage location
Muon phi boundary in the barrel region
Muon phi boundary in the endcap region

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &directory="", const std::string &directoryElectron="", const std::string &electronFileVersion="rel17p2.v02")
memberdef.name: LeptonTriggerSF

detaileddescription.para: constructor The constructor expects the directory name under which the efficiency file(s) can be found, when running in stand-alone ROOT mode. When running in an Athena job it can try to guess the correct location, but it may need some help even in that case.
The directory can be any directory that ROOT understands, so you can point the tool to a DCAP, XRootD or even a web server if you want to.

parameterdescription.para: [in] path to the directory that contains efficiency file(s)
[in] path to the directory that contains efficiency files for ElectronEfficiencyCorrection
[in] version string of the efficiency files for ElectronEfficiencyCorrection

memberdef.argsstring: (const int year, const std::string &directory="", const std::string &fileName="", const std::string &directoryElectron="", const std::string &electronFileVersion="rel17p2.v02")

memberdef.name: createMcReplicaMuon

detaileddescription.para: Creates MC replica of efficiency maps
n Efficiency maps are created. MC replica has eff_ij[n] where eff_ij[n] is generated with Gaussian using parameters, mu = efficiency at bin [ij] with sigma = statistical error of the bin [ij]

parameterdescription.para: [in] number of replica to be created

memberdef.name: initialise

detaileddescription.para: Initialisation method

The initialisation takes care of reading in all the efficiency histograms from the ROOT file found in the package. It makes a copy of every histogram in memory, and takes ownership of them. It then needs to delete each one of them in its destructor.

parameterdescription.para: [in] path to the directory that contains efficiency file(s)
[in] file name of the efficiency file
[in] an array specifing offline muon quality

detaileddescription.para: Function to calculate the uncertainty on the SF

briefdescription.para: Class providing trigger scale factors for analyses using electrons and muons.

detaileddescription.para: This tool can be used to get the scale factors and their uncertainties in events with multiple electrons/muons.
